blocks.name: getAccessToken
blocks.description: Use the OAuth request to get an access token for use with your payments calls.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Required: Client id.

args.name: secret
args.info: Required: secret

args.name: grantType
args.info: Required: Token grant type. Must be set to client_credentials.

blocks.name: createPayment
blocks.description: Use the payment resource for direct credit card payments, stored credit card payments, or PayPal account payments.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: intent
args.info: Required: Payment intent. Must be set to sale for immediate payment, authorize to authorize a payment for capture later, or order to create an order. Allowed values: sale, authorize, order.

args.name: payer
args.info: Required: Source of the funds for this payment represented by a PayPal account or a direct credit card.

args.name: transactions
args.info: Required: Transaction details, if updating a payment. Note that this instance of the transactions object accepts only the amount object.

args.name: experienceProfileId
args.info: Optional: PayPal generated identifier for the merchant's payment experience profile.

args.name: noteToPayer
args.info: Optional: free-form field for the use of clients to pass in a message to the payer.

args.name: redirectUrls
args.info: Optional: Set of redirect URLs you provide only for PayPal-based payments.

blocks.name: executePayment
blocks.description: Executes a PayPal payment that the payer has approved. You can optionally pass in one or more transactions to update transaction information when you execute the payment.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: paymentId
args.info: Required: The ID of the payment to execute.

args.name: payerId
args.info: Required: The ID of the payer, passed in the return_url by PayPal.

args.name: transactions
args.info: Optional: Transactional details if updating a payment. Note that this instance of the transactions object accepts only the amount object.

blocks.name: getPayment
blocks.description: Shows details for a payment, by ID, that is yet completed. For example, a payment that was created, approved, or failed.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: paymentId
args.info: Required: The ID of the payment to execute.

blocks.name: updatePayment
blocks.description: Partially updates a payment, by ID. You cannot update a payment after the payment is executed.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: paymentId
args.info: Required: The ID of the payment to execute.

args.name: items
args.info: Required: A JSON patch object that you can use to apply partial updates to resources.

blocks.name: getPaymentList
blocks.description: Lists payments that were created by the create payment call and are in any state. The list shows the payments that are made to the merchant who makes the call.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: count
args.info: Optional: The number of items to list in the response. Default: 10.

args.name: startId
args.info: Optional: The ID of the starting resource in the response. When results are paged, you can use the next_id value as the start_id to continue with the next set of results.

args.name: startIndex
args.info: Optional: The start index of the resources to return. Typically used to jump to a specific position in the resource history based on its cart. Example for starting at the second item in a list of results: ?start_index=2

args.name: startTime
args.info: Optional: The date and time when the resource was created. Indicates the start of a range of results. Example: start_time=2013-03-06T11:00:00Z Format: date-time.

args.name: endTime
args.info: Optional: The date and time when the resource was created. Indicates the end of a range of results. Format: date-time.

blocks.name: getSale
blocks.description: Shows details for a sale transaction, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: saleId
args.info: Required: The ID of the sale for which to show details.

blocks.name: refundSale
blocks.description: Refunds a completed payment.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: saleId
args.info: Required: The ID of the sale for which to show details.

args.name: amount
args.info: Optional: Refund details including both the refunded amount to payer and refunded fee to payee. If you do not provide an amount, you must still provide an empty JSON payload in the body to indicate a full refund.

args.name: refundSource
args.info: Optional: Type of PayPal funding source (balance or eCheck) that can be used for auto refund. Allowed values: INSTANT_FUNDING_SOURCE, ECHECK, UNRESTRICTED. Default: UNRESTRICTED.

args.name: invoiceNumber
args.info: Optional: The invoice number that is used to track this payment. Character length and limitations: 127 single-byte alphanumeric characters. Maximum length: 127.

args.name: refundAdvice
args.info: Optional: Flag to indicate that the buyer was already given store credit for a given transaction.

blocks.name: getRefund
blocks.description: Shows details for a refund, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: refundId
args.info: Required: The ID of the refund for which to show details.

blocks.name: getAuthorization
blocks.decription: Shows details for an authorization, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: authorizationId
args.info: Required: The ID of the authorization for which to show details.

blocks.name: captureAuthorization
blocks.description: Use this resource to capture and process a previously created authorization.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: authorizationId
args.info: Required: The ID of the authorization for which to show details.

args.name: amount
args.info: Optional: The amount to capture. If the amount matches the orginally authorized amount, the state of the authorization changes to captured. If not, the state of the authorization changes to partially_captured.

args.name: isFinalCapture
args.info: Optional: Indicates whether to release all remaining funds that the authorization holds in the funding instrument. Default is false. Default: false.

args.name: invoiceNumber
args.info: Optional: The invoice number to track this payment. Maximum length: 127.

blocks.name: voidAuthorization
blocks.description: Voids a previously authorized payment.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: authorizationId
args.info: Required: The ID of the authorization for which to show details.

blocks.name: reauthorizePayment
blocks.description: Reauthorizes a PayPal account payment. We recommend that you reauthorize a payment after the initial three-day honor period to ensure that funds are still available.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: authorizationId
args.info: Required: The ID of the authorization for which to show details.

args.name: amount
args.info: Required: Amount being reauthorized.

blocks.name: getCapture
blocks.description: Shows details for a captured payment, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: captureId
args.info: Required: The ID of the captured payment for which to show details.

blocks.name: refundCapture
blocks.description: Refunds a captured payment, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: captureId
args.info: Required: The ID of the captured payment for which to show details.

args.name: amount
args.info: Optional: The amount to be refunded to the original payer by the payee.

args.name: description
args.info: Optional: Description of what is being refunded for. Character length and limitations: 255 single-byte alphanumeric characters.

args.name: refundSource
args.info: Optional: Type of PayPal funding source (balance or eCheck) that can be used for auto refund. Allowed values: INSTANT_FUNDING_SOURCE, ECHECK, UNRESTRICTED. Default: UNRESTRICTED.

args.name: reason
args.info: Optional: Reason description for the Sale transaction being refunded.

args.name: invoiceNumber
args.info: Optional: The invoice number that is used to track this payment. Character length and limitations: 127 single-byte alphanumeric characters.

args.name: refundAdvice
args.info: Optional: Flag to indicate that the buyer was already given store credit for a given transaction.

blocks.name: getOrder
blocks.description: Shows details for an order, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: orderId
args.info: Required: The ID of the order for which to show details.

blocks.name: authorizeOrder
blocks.description: Authorizes an order, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: orderId
args.info: Required: The ID of the order for which to show details.

args.name: amount
args.info: Required: Amount being collected.

blocks.name: captureOrder
blocks.description: Captures a payment on an order.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: orderId
args.info: Required: The ID of the order for which to show details.

args.name: amount
args.info: Optional: The amount to capture. If the amount matches the orginally authorized amount, the state of the authorization changes to captured. If not, the state of the authorization changes to partially_captured.

args.name: isFinalCapture
args.info: Optional: Indicates whether to release all remaining funds that the authorization holds in the funding instrument. Default is false. Default: false.

args.name: invoiceNumber
args.info: Optional: The invoice number to track this payment.

args.name: transactionFee
args.info: Optional: The transaction fee for this payment.

blocks.name: voidOrder
blocks.description: Voids an order, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: orderId
args.info: Required: The ID of the order to void.

blocks.name: createPlan
blocks.description: You can create an empty billing plan and add a trial period and/or regular billing. Alternatively, you can create a fully loaded plan that includes both a trial period and regular billing.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: name
args.info: Required: The billing plan name.

args.name: description
args.info: Required: The billing plan description.

args.name: type
args.info: Required: The billing plan type. Allowed values: FIXED, INFINITE.

args.name: paymentDefinitions
args.info: Required: Resource that represents payment definition scheduling information.

args.name: merchantPreferences
args.info: Optional: Resource that represents the merchant preferences for a plan, such as max failed attempts, set up fee, and so on.

blocks.name: updatePlan
blocks.description: You can update the information for an existing billing plan. The state of a plan must be active before a billing agreement is created.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: planId
args.info: Required: The ID of the billing plan to update.

args.name: items
args.info: Optional: A JSON patch object used for applying partial updates to resources.

blocks.name: getPlan
blocks.description: Use this call to get details about a specific billing plan.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: planId
args.info: Required: The ID of the billing plan to update.

blocks.name: getPlanList
blocks.description: Use this call to get a list of all billing plans based on their current state and optional query string parameters.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: page
args.info: Optional: The page to return. Default is 0.

args.name: status
args.info: Optional: The state. Default is CREATED. Possible values: created, active, inactive.

args.name: pageSize
args.info: Optional: The maximum number of results to return at one time. A valid value is a non-negative, non-zero integer. Default is 10.

args.name: totalRequired
args.info: Optional: The total number of items and pages to return in the response.

blocks.name: createAgreement
blocks.description: Creates a billing agreement for the buyer.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: name
args.info: Required: Name of the agreement. Maximum length: 128.

args.name: description
args.info: Required: Description of the agreement. Maximum length: 128.

args.name: startDate
args.info: Required: Start date of the agreement. Date format yyyy-MM-dd z, as defined in ISO8601. Format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSTimeZone.

args.name: payer
args.info: Required: A resource representing a Payer that funds a payment.

args.name: plan
args.info: Required: Billing plan resource that will be used to create a billing agreement.

args.name: agreementDetails
args.info: Optional: A resource representing the agreement details.

args.name: shippingAddress
args.info: Optional: Base Address object used as billing address in a payment or extended for Shipping Address.

args.name: overrideChargeModels
args.info: Optional: A resource representing an override_charge_model to be used during creation of the agreement.

args.name: overrideMerchantPreferences
args.info: Optional: Resource representing merchant preferences like max failed attempts,set up fee and others for a plan.

blocks.name: executeAgreement
blocks.description: Executes an agreement after the buyer approves it.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: paymentToken
args.info: Required: Identifier of the agreement resource to execute.

blocks.name: updateAgreement
blocks.description: Updates an agreement, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: agreementId
args.info: Required: Identifier of the agreement resource to update.

args.name: items
args.info: Required: A JSON patch object used for applying partial updates to resources.

blocks.name: getAgreement
blocks.description: Shows details for an agreement, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: agreementId
args.info: Required: Identifier of the agreement resource to retrieve.

blocks.name: suspendAgreement
blocks.description: Suspends an agreement, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: agreementId
args.info: Required: Identifier of the agreement resource to suspend.

args.name: note
args.info: Required: Reason for changing the state of the agreement. Maximum length: 128.

args.name: amount
args.info: Optional: Base object for all financial value related fields (balance, payment due, etc.)

blocks.name: reactivateAgreement
blocks.description: Reactivates an agreement, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: agreementId
args.info: Required: Identifier of the agreement resource to re-activate.

args.name: note
args.info: Required: Reason for changing the state of the agreement. Maximum length: 128.

args.name: amount
args.info: Optional: Base object for all financial value related fields (balance, payment due, etc.)

blocks.name: cancelAgreement
blocks.description: Cancels an agreement, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: agreementId
args.info: Required: Identifier of the agreement resource to cancel.

args.name: note
args.info: Required: Reason for changing the state of the agreement. Maximum length: 128.

args.name: amount
args.info: Optional: Base object for all financial value related fields (balance, payment due, etc.)

blocks.name: getTransactionsForBillingAgreement
blocks.description: Lists transactions for a billing agreement.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: agreementId
args.info: Required: Identifier of the agreement resource to cancel.

args.name: startDate
args.info: Required: The start date of the range of transactions to list.

args.name: endDate
args.info: Required: The end date of the range of transactions to list.

blocks.name: setAgreementBalance
blocks.description: Sets the outstanding amount of an agreement, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: agreementId
args.info: Required: Identifier of the agreement resource to cancel.

args.name: currency
args.info: Required: 3 letter currency code as defined by ISO 4217.

args.name: value
args.info: Required: amount up to N digit after the decimals separator as defined in ISO 4217 for the appropriate currency code

blocks.name: billAgreementBalance
blocks.description: Bills the outstanding amount of an agreement, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: agreementId
args.info: Required: Identifier of the agreement resource to cancel.

args.name: note
args.info: Required: Reason for changing the state of the agreement. Maximum length: 128.

args.name: amount
args.info: Required: Base object for all financial value related fields (balance, payment due, etc.)

blocks.name: createPayout
blocks.description: You can make payouts to one or more PayPal accounts.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: senderBatchHeader
args.info: Required: The sender-provided batch header for a batch payout request.

args.name: items
args.info: Required: A sender-created definition of a payout to a single recipient. Maximum length: 5000.

args.name: syncMode
args.info: Optional: Set to true to return an immediate and synchronous response. Default is false, which returns an asynchronous response in the background.

blocks.name: getPayout
blocks.description: Periodically shows the latest status of a batch payout along with the transaction status and other data for individual items.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: payoutBatchId
args.info: Required: The ID of the batch payout for which to show status.

args.name: fields
args.info: Optional: Shows details for only specified fields.

blocks.name: getPayoutItem
blocks.description: Shows the details for a payout item. Use this call to review the current status of a previously unclaimed, or pending, payout item.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: payoutItemId
args.info: Required: The ID of the payout item for which to show details.

blocks.name: cancelPayoutItem
blocks.description: Cancels an unclaimed transaction. If no one claims the unclaimed item within 30 days, the funds are automatically returned to the sender. Use this call to cancel the unclaimed item before the automatic 30-day refund.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: payoutItemId
args.info: Required: The ID of the payout item for which to show details.

blocks.name: createCreditCard
blocks.description: Stores credit card details with PayPal.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: number
args.info: Required: Credit card number. Valid value is numeric characters with no spaces or punctuation. The string must conform with modulo and length required by each credit card type.

args.name: type
args.info: Required: Credit card type. Allowed values: visa, mastercard, amex, discover, maestro.

args.name: expireMonth
args.info: Required: Expiration month with no leading zero.

args.name: expireYear
args.info: Required: The 4-digit card expiry year.

args.name: cvv2
args.info: Optional: The 3 to 4 digit card validation code.

args.name: firstName
args.info: Optional: The first name of the card holder. Maximum length is 25 characters.

args.name: lastName
args.info: Optional: The last name of the card holder.

args.name: billingAddress
args.info: Optional: Base Address object used as billing address in a payment or extended for Shipping Address.

args.name: externalCustomerId
args.info: Optional: Externally provided ID of the customer for which to list credit card resources.

args.name: merchantId
args.info: Optional: ID of the merchant for which to list credit card resources.

args.name: payerId
args.info: Optional:  unique ID that you can assign and track when you store a credit card or use a stored credit card.

args.name: externalCardId
args.info: Optional:  Externally provided ID of the card for which to list credit card resources.

blocks.name: deleteCreditCard
blocks.description: Deletes details of a stored credit card. Include the credit card ID in the request URI.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: creditCardId
args.info: Required: The ID of the credit card resource for which to show data.

blocks.name: getCreditCard
blocks.description: Shows details for a stored credit card.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: creditCardId
args.info: Required: The ID of the credit card resource for which to show data.

blocks.name: getCreditCardList
blocks.description: Lists stored credit cards.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: pageSize
args.info: Optional: The number of resources to list, starting with the specified page. Default: 10.

args.name: page
args.info: Optional: The number of pages to get. Default: 1.

args.name: startTime
args.info: Optional: The date and time when the resource was created in ISO8601 date-time format that indicates the start of a range of results. For example, 2013-11-05T13:15:30Z.

args.name: endTime
args.info: Optional: The date and time when the resource was created in ISO8601 date-time format that indicates the end of a range of results. For example, 2014-11-05T13:15:30Z.

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: Optional: Sorts the response in ascending or descending order. Value is asc for ascending order or desc for descending order. Default: desc.

args.name: sortBy
args.info: Optional: Sorts the response by create_time or update_time. Default: create_time.

args.name: merchantId
args.info: Optional: A user-provided, optional field that functions as a unique identifier for the merchant holding the card. Note that this has no relation to PayPal merchant ID.

args.name: externalCardId
args.info: Optional: A unique identifier of the bank account resource. Generated and provided by the facilitator to use to restrict the usage of the bank account to the specific merchant.

args.name: externalCustomerId
args.info: Optional: Externally provided customer identifier to filter the search results in list operations.

args.name: totalRequired
args.info: Optional: Indicates whether the response returns the total_items and total_pages values. Default is true. Set to false to omit these values from the response.

blocks.name: updateCreditCard
blocks.description: Updates a stored credit card, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: creditCardId
args.info: Required: The ID of the credit card resource to update.

args.name: items
args.info: Required: A JSON patch object used for applying partial updates to resources.

blocks.name: createTokenFromAurhorizationCode
blocks.description: Updates a stored credit card, by ID.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Required: Client id.

args.name: secret
args.info: Required: secret

args.name: grantType
args.info: Required: Token grant type. Value must be set to authorization_code.

args.name: code
args.info: Required: Authorization code previously received from the authorization server.

args.name: redirectUri
args.info: Required: AApplication return URL where the authorization code is sent.

blocks.name: createTokenFromRefreshToken
blocks.description: Create an access token from a refresh token.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Required: Client id.

args.name: secret
args.info: Required: secret

args.name: grantType
args.info: Required: Token grant type. Value must be set to authorization_code.

args.name: refreshToken
args.info: Required: Refresh token previously received along with the access token that is to be refreshed.

args.name: scope
args.info: Optional: Resource URL endpoints that the client wants the token to be scoped for. The value of the scope parameter is expressed as a list of space-delimited, case-sensitive strings.

blocks.name: getUser
blocks.description: Use this call to retrieve user profile attributes.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: schema
args.info: Required: the schema that is used to return as per openidconnect protocol. Possible values: openid.

blocks.name: createInvoice
blocks.description: Creates a draft invoice.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: merchantInfo
args.info: Required: Merchant business information that appears on the invoice.

args.name: number
args.info: Optional: The unique invoice number. If you omit this number, it is auto-incremented from the previous invoice number. Maximum length: 25.

args.name: templateId
args.info: Optional: The ID of the template from which to create the invoice. Useful for copy functionality.

args.name: billingInfo
args.info: Optional: Billing information for the invoice recipient.

args.name: ccInfo
args.info: Optional: Participant information.

args.name: shippingInfo
args.info: Optional: Shipping information for the invoice recipient.

args.name: items
args.info: Optional: Line item information.

args.name: invoiceDate
args.info: Optional: The date when the invoice was enabled. The date format is yyyy-MM-dd z.

args.name: paymentTerm
args.info: Optional: The payment term of the invoice. If you specify term_type, you cannot specify due_date, and vice versa.

args.name: reference
args.info: Optional: Reference data, such as PO number, to add to the invoice. Maximum length: 60.

args.name: discount
args.info: Optional: The cost as a percent or an amount value. For example, to specify 10%, enter 10. Alternatively, to specify an amount of 5, enter 5.

args.name: shippingCost
args.info: Optional: Shipping cost, as a percent or an amount value.

args.name: custom
args.info: Optional: The custom amount to apply to an invoice. If you include a label, you must include a custom amount.

args.name: allowPartialPayment
args.info: Optional: Indicates whether the invoice allows a partial payment. If false, invoice must be paid in full. If true, the invoice allows partial payments. Default is false.

args.name: minimumAmountDue
args.info: Optional: Base object for all financial value related fields (balance, payment due, etc.)

args.name: taxCalculatedAfterDiscount
args.info: Optional: Indicates whether the tax is calculated before or after a discount. If false, the tax is calculated before a discount. If true, the tax is calculated after a discount. Default is false.

args.name: taxInclusive
args.info: Optional: Indicates whether the unit price includes tax. Default is false.

args.name: terms
args.info: Optional: The general terms of the invoice. Maximum length: 4000.

args.name: note
args.info: Optional: A note to the payer. Maximum length: 4000.

args.name: merchantMemo
args.info: Optional: A private bookkeeping memo for the merchant. Maximum length: 150.

args.name: logoUrl
args.info: Optional: The full URL to an external logo image. Maximum length: 4000.

args.name: attachments
args.info: Optional: The array of files attached to an invoice or template.

blocks.name: sendInvoice
blocks.description: Sends an invoice, by ID, to a customer.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: invoiceId
args.info: Required: The ID of the invoice to send.

args.name: notifyMerchant
args.info: Optional: Indicates whether to send the invoice update notification to the merchant. Default is true.

blocks.name: updateInvoice
blocks.description: Updates an invoice, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: invoiceId
args.info: Required: The ID of the invoice to update.

args.name: merchantInfo
args.info: Required: Merchant business information that appears on the invoice.

args.name: notifyMerchant
args.info: Optional: Indicates whether to send the invoice update notification to the merchant. Default is true.

args.name: number
args.info: Optional: The unique invoice number. If you omit this number, it is auto-incremented from the previous invoice number. Maximum length: 25.

args.name: templateId
args.info: Optional: The ID of the template from which to create the invoice. Useful for copy functionality.

args.name: billingInfo
args.info: Optional: Billing information for the invoice recipient.

args.name: ccInfo
args.info: Optional: Participant information.

args.name: shippingInfo
args.info: Optional: Shipping information for the invoice recipient.

args.name: items
args.info: Optional: Line item information.

args.name: invoiceDate
args.info: Optional: The date when the invoice was enabled. The date format is yyyy-MM-dd z.

args.name: paymentTerm
args.info: Optional: The payment term of the invoice. If you specify term_type, you cannot specify due_date, and vice versa.

args.name: reference
args.info: Optional: Reference data, such as PO number, to add to the invoice. Maximum length: 60.

args.name: discount
args.info: Optional: The cost as a percent or an amount value. For example, to specify 10%, enter 10. Alternatively, to specify an amount of 5, enter 5.

args.name: shippingCost
args.info: Optional: Shipping cost, as a percent or an amount value.

args.name: custom
args.info: Optional: The custom amount to apply to an invoice. If you include a label, you must include a custom amount.

args.name: allowPartialPayment
args.info: Optional: Indicates whether the invoice allows a partial payment. If false, invoice must be paid in full. If true, the invoice allows partial payments. Default is false.

args.name: minimumAmountDue
args.info: Optional: Base object for all financial value related fields (balance, payment due, etc.)

args.name: taxCalculatedAfterDiscount
args.info: Optional: Indicates whether the tax is calculated before or after a discount. If false, the tax is calculated before a discount. If true, the tax is calculated after a discount. Default is false.

args.name: taxInclusive
args.info: Optional: Indicates whether the unit price includes tax. Default is false.

args.name: terms
args.info: Optional: The general terms of the invoice. Maximum length: 4000.

args.name: note
args.info: Optional: A note to the payer. Maximum length: 4000.

args.name: merchantMemo
args.info: Optional: A private bookkeeping memo for the merchant. Maximum length: 150.

args.name: logoUrl
args.info: Optional: The full URL to an external logo image. Maximum length: 4000.

args.name: attachments
args.info: Optional: The array of files attached to an invoice or template.

blocks.name: getInvoice
blocks.description: Shows details for an invoice, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: invoiceId
args.info: Required: The ID of the invoice to update.

blocks.name: getInvoiceList
blocks.description: Lists invoices that belong to the merchant who makes the call.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: page
args.info: Optional: A zero-relative index of the list of merchant invoices. Default: 1.

args.name: pageSize
args.info: Optional: The number of invoices to list beginning with the specified page. Default: 10.

args.name: totalCountRequired
args.info: Optional: Indicates whether the total count appears in the response. Default is false.

blocks.name: generateInvoiceNumber
blocks.description: Generates the next invoice number that is available to the user.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

blocks.name: searchInvoice
blocks.description: Lists invoices that match search criteria.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: email
args.info: Optional: The initial letters of the email address.

args.name: recipientFirstName
args.info: Optional: The initial letters of the recipient first name.

args.name: recipientLastName
args.info: Optional: The initial letters of the recipient last name.

args.name: recipientBusinessName
args.info: Optional: The initial letters of the recipient business name.

args.name: number
args.info: Optional: The invoice number.

args.name: status
args.info: Optional: The invoice status. Allowed values: DRAFT, SENT, PAID, MARKED_AS_PAID, CANCELLED, REFUNDED, PARTIALLY_REFUNDED, MARKED_AS_REFUNDED.

args.name: lowerTotalAmount
args.info: Optional: Base object for all financial value related fields (balance, payment due, etc.)

args.name: upperTotalAmount
args.info: Optional: Base object for all financial value related fields (balance, payment due, etc.)

args.name: startInvoiceDate
args.info: Optional: The start date for the invoice. Date format is yyyy-MM-dd z.

args.name: endInvoiceDate
args.info: Optional: The end date for the invoice. Date format is yyyy-MM-dd z.

args.name: startDueDate
args.info: Optional: The start due date for the invoice. Date format is yyyy-MM-dd z.

args.name: endDueDate
args.info: Optional: The end due date for the invoice. Date format is yyyy-MM-dd z.

args.name: startPaymentDate
args.info: Optional: The start payment date for the invoice. Date format is yyyy-MM-dd z.

args.name: endPaymentDate
args.info: Optional: The end payment date for the invoice. Date format is yyyy-MM-dd z.

args.name: startCreationDate
args.info: Optional: The start creation date for the invoice. Date format is yyyy-MM-dd z.

args.name: endCreationDate
args.info: Optional: The end creation date for the invoice. Date format is yyyy-MM-dd z.

args.name: page
args.info: Optional: The offset for the search results.

args.name: pageSize
args.info: Optional: The page size for the search results.

args.name: totalCountRequired
args.info: Optional: Indicates whether the total count appears in the response. Default is false.

args.name: archived
args.info: Optional: Indicates whether to list merchant-archived invoices in the response. If true, response lists only merchant-archived invoices. If false, response lists only unarchived invoices. If null, response lists all invoices.

blocks.name: sendInvoiceReminder
blocks.description: Sends a reminder to the payer that a payment is due for an invoice, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: invoiceId
args.info: Required: The ID of the invoice.

args.name: subject
args.info: Required: The subject of the notification.

args.name: note
args.info: Required: A note to the payer.

args.name: sendToMerchant
args.info: Required: Indicates whether to send a copy of the email to the merchant. True or false.

args.name: ccEmails
args.info: Optional: An array of one or more Cc: emails.

blocks.name: deleteInvoice
blocks.description: Deletes a draft invoice, by ID. Note that this call works for invoices in the draft state only.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: invoiceId
args.info: Required: The ID of the invoice.

blocks.name: getQRCode
blocks.description: Generates a QR code for an invoice, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: invoiceId
args.info: Required: The ID of the invoice.

args.name: width
args.info: Optional: The width, in pixels, of the QR code image. Valid value is from 150 to 500. Default is 500.

args.name: height
args.info: Optional: The height, in pixels, of the QR code image. Valid value is from 150 to 500. Default is 500.

args.name: action
args.info: Optional: The type of URL for which to generate a QR code. Default is pay and is the only supported value.

blocks.name: getTemplate
blocks.description: Shows details for a template, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: templateId
args.info: Required: The ID of the template for which to show details.

blocks.name: getTemplateList
blocks.description: Lists all merchant-created templates. The list shows the emails, addresses, and phone numbers from the merchant profile.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: fields
args.info: Optional: The fields to return in the response. Value is all or none. Specify none to return only the template name, ID, and default attributes. Default: all.

blocks.name: createWebProfile
blocks.description: Creates a web experience profile.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: name
args.info: Required: Name of the web experience profile. Unique among only the profiles for a given merchant.

args.name: flowConfig
args.info: Optional: Parameters for flow configuration.

args.name: inputFields
args.info: Optional: Parameters for input fields customization.

args.name: presentation
args.info: Optional: Parameters for style and presentation.

blocks.name: getWebProfile
blocks.description: Shows details for a web experience profile, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: profileId
args.info: Required: ID of the profile to retrieve.

blocks.name: getProfileWebList
blocks.description: Lists web experience profiles for a merchant.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

blocks.name: updateWebProfile
blocks.description: Updates a web experience profile, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: profileId
args.info: Required: ID of the profile to update.

args.name: name
args.info: Required: Name of the web experience profile. Unique among only the profiles for a given merchant.

args.name: flowConfig
args.info: Optional: Parameters for flow configuration.

args.name: inputFields
args.info: Optional: Parameters for input fields customization.

args.name: presentation
args.info: Optional: Parameters for style and presentation.

blocks.name: deleteWebProfile
blocks.description: Deletes a web experience profile, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: profileId
args.info: Required: ID of the profile to update.

blocks.name: createWebhook
blocks.description: Subscribes your webhook listener to events.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: url
args.info: Required: The URL that is configured to listen on localhost for incoming POST notification messages that contain event information.

args.name: eventTypes
args.info: Required: A list of events.

blocks.name: getWebhook
blocks.description: Shows details for a webhook, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: webhookId
args.info: Required: aThe ID of the webhook for which to show details.

blocks.name: getWebhookList
blocks.description: Lists all webhooks.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: anchorType
args.info: Optional: Filters the response by an entity type, anchor_id. Value is APPLICATION or ACCOUNT. Default is APPLICATION.

blocks.name: updateWebhook
blocks.description: Updates a webhook, by ID. Supports only the replace operation.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: webhookId
args.info: Required: The ID of the webhook to update.

args.name: items
args.info: Required: A JSON patch object that you can use to apply partial updates to resources.

blocks.name: deleteWebhook
blocks.description: Deletes a webhook, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: webhookId
args.info: Required: The ID of the webhook to update.

blocks.name: getEventNotifications
blocks.description: Shows details for an event notification, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: eventId
args.info: Required: The ID of the webhook event notification for which to show details.

blocks.name: getEventNotificationsList
blocks.description: Lists webhook event notifications. You can specify one or more optional query parameters to filter the response.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: pageSize
args.info: Optional: The number of webhook event notifications to return in the response. Default: 10.

args.name: startTime
args.info: Optional: Filters the webhook event notifications in the response to those created on or after this date and time and on or before the endTime value.

args.name: endTime
args.info: Optional: Filters the webhook event notifications in the response to those created on or after the startTime and on or before this date and time.

args.name: transactionId
args.info: Optional: Filters the response to a single transaction, by ID.

args.name: eventType
args.info: Optional: Filters the response to a single event.

blocks.name: resendEventNotification
blocks.description: Resends an event notification, by event ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: eventId
args.info: Required: The ID of the webhook event notification to resend.

args.name: webhookIds
args.info: Required: A list of webhook account IDs.

blocks.name: getEventList
blocks.description: Lists events to which an app can subscribe.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

blocks.name: getWebhookEventSubscriptionList
blocks.description: Lists the event subscriptions for a webhook, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: webhookId
args.info: Required: The ID of the webhook for which to list subscriptions.

blocks.name: simulateWebhookEvent
blocks.description: Simulates a webhook event by using a sample payload.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: eventType
args.info: Required: The event name. Specify one of the subscribed events. For each request, provide only one event.

args.name: webhookId
args.info: Optional: The ID of the webhook. If omitted, the URL is required.

args.name: url
args.info: Optional: The URL for the webhook endpoint. If omitted, the webhook ID is required.

blocks.name: cancelSentInvoice
blocks.description: Cancels a sent invoice, by ID, and, optionally, sends a notification about the cancellation to the payer, merchant, and Cc: emails.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: invoiceId
args.info: Required: The ID of the invoice to cancel.

args.name: subject
args.info: Optional: The subject of the notification.

args.name: note
args.info: Optional: A note to the payer.

args.name: sendToMerchant
args.info: Optional: Indicates whether to send the notification to the merchant.

args.name: sendToPayer
args.info: Optional: Indicates whether to send the notification to the payer.

args.name: ccEmails
args.info: Optional: An array of one or more Cc: emails. If you omit this parameter from the JSON request body, a notification is sent to all Cc: email addresses that are part of the invoice. Otherwise, specify this parameter to limit the email addresses to which a notification is sent.

blocks.name: markInvoiceAsPaid
blocks.description: Marks an invoice, by ID, as paid.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: invoiceId
args.info: Required: The ID of the invoice to cancel.

args.name: method
args.info: Required: The payment mode or method. Required with the EXTERNAL payment type. Value is bank transfer, cash, check, credit card, debit card, PayPal, wire transfer, or other. Allowed values: BANK_TRANSFER, CASH, CHECK, CREDIT_CARD, DEBIT_CARD, PAYPAL, WIRE_TRANSFER, OTHER.

args.name: date
args.info: Optional: The date when the invoice was paid. The date format is yyyy-MM-dd z

args.name: note
args.info: Optional: A note associated with the payment.

args.name: amount
args.info: Optional: Base object for all financial value related fields (balance, payment due, etc.)

blocks.name: markInvoiceAsRefunded
blocks.description: Marks an invoice, by ID, as refunded.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: invoiceId
args.info: Required: The ID of the invoice.

args.name: date
args.info: Optional: The date when the invoice was paid. The date format is yyyy-MM-dd z

args.name: note
args.info: Optional: A note associated with the payment.

args.name: amount
args.info: Optional: Base object for all financial value related fields (balance, payment due, etc.)

blocks.name: deleteExternalPayment
blocks.description: Deletes an external payment transaction, by ID, from an invoice, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: invoiceId
args.info: Required: The ID of the invoice from which to delete a payment transaction.

args.name: transactionId
args.info: Required: The ID of the payment transaction to delete.

blocks.name: deleteExternalRefund
blocks.description: Deletes an external refund transaction, by ID, from an invoice, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: invoiceId
args.info: Required: The ID of the invoice from which to delete the refund transaction.

args.name: transactionId
args.info: Required: The ID of the refund transaction to delete.

blocks.name: createTemplate
blocks.description: Creates an invoice template. When you create an invoice from a template, the invoice is populated with the predefined data that the source template contains.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: name
args.info: Required: The template name.

args.name: default
args.info: Required: Indicates whether this template is the default merchant template. A merchant can have one default template. True or false

args.name: templateData
args.info: Required: Detailed template information.

args.name: settings
args.info: Required: Template settings.

args.name: unitOfMeasure
args.info: Required: The unit of measure for the template. Value is quantity, hours, or amount.

blocks.name: deleteTemplate
blocks.description: Deletes a template, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: templateId
args.info: Required: The ID of the template to delete.

blocks.name: verifyWebhookSignature
blocks.description: Verifies a webhook signature.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: authAlgo
args.info: Required: The algorithm that PayPal uses to generate the signature and that you can use to verify the signature. Extract this value from the PAYPAL-AUTH-ALGO response header, which is received with the webhook notification.

args.name: certUrl
args.info: Required: The X.509 public key certificate. Download the certificate from this URL and use it to verify the signature. Extract this value from the PAYPAL-CERT-URL response header, which is received with the webhook notification.

args.name: transmissionId
args.info: Required: The ID of the HTTP transmission. Contained in the PAYPAL-TRANSMISSION-ID header of the notification message.

args.name: transmissionSig
args.info: Required: The PayPal-generated asymmetric signature. Extract this value from the PAYPAL-TRANSMISSION-SIG response header, which is received with the webhook notification.

args.name: transmissionTime
args.info: Required: The date and time of the HTTP transmission. Contained in the PAYPAL-TRANSMISSION-TIME header of the notification message.

args.name: webhookId
args.info: Required: The ID of the webhook as configured in your Developer Portal account.

args.name: webhookEvent
args.info: Required: A webhook event notification.

blocks.name: updateTemplate
blocks.description: Updates a template, by ID. In the JSON request body, pass a complete template object. The update method does not support partial updates.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: templateId
args.info: Required: The ID of the template to update.

args.name: name
args.info: Required: The template name.

args.name: default
args.info: Required: Indicates whether this template is the default merchant template. A merchant can have one default template. True or false

args.name: templateData
args.info: Required: Detailed template information.

args.name: settings
args.info: Required: Template settings.

args.name: unitOfMeasure
args.info: Required: The unit of measure for the template. Value is quantity, hours, or amount.
